messages.subject: What if my website disappeared?
messages.msgSnippet: I ve been thinking about what would change in my life if my websie disappeared. The good news: I would save $130 a year and a lot of time. BAD NEWS:  I have
messages.messageBody:
I've been thinking about what would change in my life if my websie disappeared.  


The good news: I would save $130 a year and a lot of time.


BAD NEWS:  I have photos there, my family tree, thousands of pages of unschooling ideas and testimonials.


Well the partly good news is that it's not totally gone, and might all return, I hope.  I've reported the problem (with feeling).


Meanwhile, one of the pages that remained was my custom 404 page, which usually says good guess, but no, and has a link for people to report the problem, and another link to a site search.


As of this evening, it has alternate links, and an apology for the trouble. :-)


Maybe check it out  Some pages are still good.  http://sandradodd.com is there, and some of the links work.  Some don'tl   Or go directly to the bad link page with http://sandradodd.com/food


AND THIS:  If that /food link above gets to "The Full Plate Club," then the problem is (at least partly) solved.  Hooray!  Either way, there are good things in the world, and lots are linked at my error page today.


Sandra
